monq.stuff

Interface Feeder

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable, Service
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractPipe, CharSequenceFeeder, DfaRunFeeder, Pipe, ReaderFeeder

    public interface Feeder
extends Service

    Implementations of Feeder start feeding data to the OutputStream passed to setOut() as soon as their Runnable.run() method is called. The contract for use of a Feeder is as follows:

    1. setOut() is called first to specify where the Feeder must deliver the data,
    2. then run() (according the inherited interface Service) is called for the the Feeder to actually deliver the data,
    3. the Feeder closes the OutputStream set with setOut depening on the second parameter of setOut before run() terminates.

    Hint: A Feeder can be easily implemented by subclassing AbstractPipe.

    Author:
    © 2005 Harald Kirsch
    See Also:
    Drainer

      • setOut

        void setOut(java.io.OutputStream out,
          boolean closeOnExit)

        specifies the OutputStream where to deliver the data in the run() method.

        Parameters:
        closeOnExit - if true, instructs the Feeder to close out before exiting run().
